character_name: Captain Virgil Hilts 'The Cooler King': one of three Americans in the camp

Flight Lieutenant Bob Hendley 'The Scrounger': an American serving in an RAF Eagle Squadron. He is responsible for finding materials that will be necessary for the POWs during the escape attempt and on the outside.
Squadron Leader Roger Bartlett 'Big X': an ambitious RAF officer

Group Captain Ramsey 'The SBO': the Senior British Officer and de facto commanding officer of the prisoners.  He serves as an intermediary between the POWs and the Germans. Ramsey is taken aback at Bartlett's plan

Flight Lieutenant Danny Welinski 'Tunnel King': a Polish refugee who escaped Nazi-held Poland and went to England to join up in the fight against the Nazis. He suffers from claustrophobia and is fearful of tunnel collapses
Flight Lieutenant Colin Blythe 'The Forger': a mild-mannered and good-natured master forger with a love of bird-watching who requires paper
Flying Officer Louis Sedgwick 'The Manufacturer': an Australian officer who constructs objects necessary to implement the escape.[note 1]
Oberst von Luger 'The Kommandant': the Commandant of the camp and a senior Luftwaffe officer
Lieutenant-Commander Eric Ashley-Pitt 'Dispersal': a Fleet Air Arm officer who finds an ingenious way to get rid of the dirt being brought up from the tunnels.
Flight Lieutenant Andy MacDonald 'Intelligence': Bartlett's second-in-command in planning the escape.
Flight Lieutenant Willie Dickes 'Tunnel King': Danny's best friend
Flying Officer Archie Ives 'The Mole : a Scottish airman who has an intense desire to escape
Flight Lieutenant Dennis Cavendish 'The Surveyor': a Flight Lieutenant who has an important duty for the building of the tunnel.
Werner 'The Ferret': a young
Second Lieutenant Goff: the third American in the camp.
Kuhn: a Gestapo officer who had Bartlett as a prisoner. An ardent Nazi
Stabsfeldwebel Strachwitz
Sorren 'Security'
Hauptmann Posen
Preissen: a high-ranking Gestapo official
SD Hauptsturmführer Dietrich: one of the SS officers who had Bartlett as a prisoner.
Haynes 'Diversions'
Griffith 'Tailor'
Kramer
Dai Nimmo 'Diversions'
SD Untersturmführer Steinach: one of the SS officers who had Bartlett as a prisoner.
